name: clmabl

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c0, cabl), wcel(c0, clmod))
stmt.pretty: syl(c0 ∈ CMod, c0 ∈ Abel, c0 ∈ LMod)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c0, cabl))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c0, clmod))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c0, cabl))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CMod → c0 ∈ Abel)
⊣ (c0 ∈ CMod → c0 ∈ LMod)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LMod → c0 ∈ Abel)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c0, cabl))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c0, clmod))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c0, cabl))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CMod → c0 ∈ Abel)
⊣ (c0 ∈ CMod → c0 ∈ LMod)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LMod → c0 ∈ Abel)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cclm), wcel(c0, cabl))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clmod), wcel(c0, cabl))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CMod → c0 ∈ Abel)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LMod → c0 ∈ Abel)

comment: A subcomplex module is an abelian group. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Oct-2015.)
